items.title: All Season
items.description: Most common: Good handle on dry, wet or snow

items.title: All Terrain
items.description: All-terrain tires offer drivers traction on- and off-road, and are typically used by light truck and SUV drivers who want a tire that's able to climb rocks and perform on the highway.

items.title: Winter
items.description: For snow, ice, and freezing temperatures

items.title: Highway
items.description: Highway terrain tires are commonly used on light trucks and SUVs that typically haul materials or need to conquer highways and some off-road terrains.

items.title: All Weather
items.description: Combines an All Season and Winter tire traits for strong traction year-round

items.title: Summer
items.description: For dry roads and warm, arid climates

items.title: UHP
items.description: Used on sports and super cars in warm weather, sporty handling, and quick acceleration

items.title: Sport
items.description: Sport Trucks typically feature a wide, low profile and offer drivers responsive handling and strong traction on paved roads.

items.title: Performance
items.description: For sport/luxury vehicles and high-speed handling

content.body:
### Shop 255/55R20 tire size If you’ve seen a Ford Explorer, Lincoln Aviator, Chevrolet Colorado or Buick Enclave, you’ve seen a vehicle that’s driving around on 255/55R20 tires. This is a tire size that’s predominantly found on crossovers; for most drivers of crossovers, all-season tires make the most sense thanks to their balance of low road noise, ride quality, handling and year-round traction (even in light snow). There’s a good selection of premium all-season tires in the 255/55R20 size; check out tires like the [Pirelli Scorpion All Season Plus 3](https://simpletire.com/brands/pirelli-tires/scorpion-all-season-plus-3), Firestone Destination LE3, Yokohama Geolandar CV G058, and Kumho Crugen HP71. Popular vehicles: 2020-2021 Ford Explorer
2019-2021 Lincoln Aviator
2015-2021 Chevrolet Colorado
2009-2021 Buick Enclave Do you live in a part of the country that gets moderate to heavy ice, slush, and snow in the winter months? While all-season tires can be used year-round, they struggle in more severe winter weather, making winter tires a good choice to combat these elements. Consider the [Bridgestone Blizzak DM-V2](https://simpletire.com/brands/bridgestone-tires/blizzak-dm-v2), Pirelli Scorpion Winter, Nokian Hakkapeliitta R3 SUV, or Toyo Observe GSI-5 if you want a dedicated winter tire for your ride; just be sure to change your tires once temperatures are consistently above 45 degrees Fahrenheit. Crossovers aren’t really made for any serious off-roading, but many are equipped with all wheel drive. All-terrain tires have a more aggressive tread design and tougher casing and rubber formulation for traction while still offering good road manners, and tires like the [Toyo Open Country A/T III](https://simpletire.com/brands/toyo-tires/open-country-a-t-iii), Falken Wildpeak A/T Trail, and Radar Renegade A/T 5 are all good options in the 255/55R20 size. Whether you drive a Buick Enclave, Chevrolet Colorado, Ford Explorer, or something else, SimpleTire has a set of 255/55R20 tires that meets your needs at a great price!

info.title: Did you know?
info.body: A reliable brand is the #1 ask for most drivers. Here you can shop all the most popular brands and discover new ones – all tested, ranked and rated by our customers.
